prism

Class ECComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • prism.ECComputer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ECComputerDefault

    public abstract class ECComputer
extends PrismComponent
    Abstract class for (symbolic) classes that compute (M)ECs, i.e. (maximal) end components, for a nondeterministic model such as an MDP.

      JDDNode getStableTransitions(JDDNode stateSet)

      JDDNode getStableTransReln(JDDNode stateSet)
      Returns the transition relation of a state set, i.e., a 0-1 MTBDD over row and col variables containing those pairs (s,t) for which there exists an alpha with P(s,alpha,t) > 0 and all alpha-successors of s are again in the state set.

      • computeMECStates

        public abstract void computeMECStates()
                               throws PrismException
        Compute states of all maximal end components (MECs) and store them. They can be retrieved using getMECStates(). You will need to to deref these afterwards.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeMECStates

        public abstract void computeMECStates(JDDNode restrict)
                               throws PrismException
        Compute states of all maximal end components (MECs) in the submodel obtained by restricting this one to the set of states restrict, and store them. They can be retrieved using getMECStates(). You will need to to deref these afterwards. If restrict is null, we look at the whole model, not a submodel.
        Parameters:
        restrict - BDD for the set of states to restrict to
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeMECStates

        public abstract void computeMECStates(JDDNode restrict,
                                      JDDNode accept)
                               throws PrismException
        Compute states of all accepting maximal end components (MECs) in the submodel obtained by restricting this one to the set of states restrict, and store them, where acceptance is defined as those which intersect with accept. They can be retrieved using getMECStates(). You will need to to deref these afterwards. If restrict is null, we look at the whole model, not a submodel. If accept is null, the acceptance condition is trivially satisfied.
        Parameters:
        restrict - BDD for the set of states to restrict to
        accept - BDD for the set of accepting states
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getMECStates

        public java.util.List<JDDNode> getMECStates()
        Get the list of states for computed MECs. You need to deref these BDDs when you are finished with them.

      • findMaximalStableSet

        public JDDNode findMaximalStableSet(JDDNode candidateStates)
        Returns the maximal stable set of states contained in candidateStates, i.e. the maximal subset of states which have a choice whose transitions remain in the subset.
        [ REFS: result, DEREFS: candidateStates ]
        Parameters:
        candidateStates - BDD for a set of states (over allDDRowVars)
        Returns:
        A referenced BDD with the maximal stable set in candidateStates

      • getStableTransReln

        public JDDNode getStableTransReln(JDDNode stateSet)
        Returns the transition relation of a state set, i.e., a 0-1 MTBDD over row and col variables containing those pairs (s,t) for which there exists an alpha with P(s,alpha,t) > 0 and all alpha-successors of s are again in the state set.
        [REFS: result, DEREFS: stateSet ]

      • getStableTransitions

        public JDDNode getStableTransitions(JDDNode stateSet)
        Get the set of transitions (s,alpha,t) that remain in the state set, i.e., with a choice alpha that ensures that the successor states are all in the state set again. Returns a 0/1-MTBDD over row, col and nondet vars.
        [ REFS: result, DEREFS: stateSet ]
        Parameters:
        stateSet - state set DD over the row variables
